channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Maley Avenue SE27 on the opposite side of the road t, 30th November
item.description:
Maley Avenue SE27 on the opposite side of the road to house number 1 is a square black litter bin that is tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maley Avenue, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering, fly tipping residential waste, 30th November
item.description:
The pavements outside the properties along that stretch of Barnabas Road are constantly littered, often litter is thrown with no bin bags, it’s both a health hazard and a very unpleasant experience for anyone accessing Homerton station.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnabas Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin on path 52, 30th November
item.description:
Constantly leaving bin overflowing on path and other food and rubbish. Issue is blocking path and attracting vermin. This is happening constantly fine needs issued.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: York Hill SE27 opposite Knolly’s Road junction (or j, 30th November
item.description:
York Hill SE27 opposite Knolly’s Road junction (or just by streetlight column ID number: 538#11) green plastic road sweeper’s bag bin graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): York Hill, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish and furniture items dumped here, 30th November
item.description:
Southwark Park Road near corner with Banyard Rd. Rubbish and furniture items dumped here daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone is trying to remove the sign, 30th November
item.description:
We walk past this sign with the dog every day. Someon e is trying to take it off and has moved the right hand side up the pole so it is now near the top and with another attempt will remove it altogether or damage it so it is unreadable. If we fix it sooner rather than later it will be cheaper to fix than buy a new sign.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72-74, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf drop making telegraph path slippery, 30th November
item.description:
Leaf drop making a slip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Hill Close, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping Selborne Road, 30th November
item.description:
The flytipping of broom, tyres, whiteboard, mattress and chair was reported under ref 8476703 on 28 November. While acknowledged, these still remain outstanding for collection please. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selborne Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Bins overflowing, 30th November
item.description:
If the litter bins are overflowing, people drop their litter on the ground and the foxes reach up and scatter it around the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Avenue, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More flytipping Daneville Road, 30th November
item.description:
Further to Ref 8476742 when the flytipped black bags, baby furniture and household items in Daneville Road were collected, further flytipped bags and baby items have now been dumped. As suggested, could this please be investigated by the manager of waste management as this pick up point for the houses opposite (3A-11) is not appropriate and has become a constant dumping ground for flytipping. These houses should have THEIR own bins and collection point on THEIR side of the street. Meanwhile could the flytipping please be collected. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Daneville Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Allyway need a litter pick, 30th November
item.description:
Please can a team clean the alleyway ASAP. It is looking untidy. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to Swallowtail Close, 30th November
item.description:
This area is very untidy and the lamppost also has vines growing up it. Please could this be cleared. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Teal Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unshielded and exceptionally bright street lighting, 30th November
item.description:
The two spotlights on exterior of building at entry of Fenner Close are exceptionally bright compared to all other street lighting in the neighbourhood. The lights are also angled upwards and are unshielded. They appear very bright from a distance and point directly at residential properties in Layard Square, Marden Square and Banyard Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging bushes, 30th November

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Teal Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Yet more flytipping here, 30th November
item.description:
Please could we have CCTV on this spot. There is one person it seems regularly dumping items here. Please can the team also check inside the bushed around the area. They also need a clean out. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Wagtail Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Street litter, 30th November
item.description:
There is an extraordinary amount of street litter. Gardiner Close up to Chalk Pit Avenue. All along the gutter. Against the church wall and generally the area needs a little pick up. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
